availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Named by French explorers for a game played by local Native Americans. Nathan Myrick first settled the area in 1841 in hopes of launching a fur trading business. The town was incorporated in 1856. It is the county seat of La Crosse County.

bibl.p: “La Crosse, Wisconsin-A Brief History,” Wisconsin Historical Society, http://www.wisconsinhistory.org/Content.aspx?dsNav=Ny:True,Ro:0,N:4294963828-4294963805&dsNavOnly=Ntk:All%7cla+crosse%7c3%7c,Ny:True,Ro:0&dsRecordDetails=R:CS2392&dsDimensionSearch=D:la+crosse,Dxm:All,Dxp:3&dsCompoundDimensionSearch=D:la+crosse,Dxm:All,Dxp:3
